intro: Chrysanthemum gossypinum, commonly known as the cotton chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its fluffy, cotton-like flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale yellow, and it blooms in the autumn season. It is often cultivated for ornamental purposes and has historical use in traditional medicine.
